review: Chromecast is God's wonderful gift to mankind. The device streams seamlessly from Netflix, Hulu Plus, and HBOgo. I had an issue setting it up, but it was my computer's fire wall. Using the iPhone app eliminated the issue, and Google's Help Desk was more than helpful.
author: Amanda Hoddy

review: I'll admit it... I love this device. Makes playing netflix movies ultra-simple and avoids having to boot up the PS3 or similar bulky devices to connect. I can use my phone or any of my android tablets to control it (I think it also works with Apple products, but I'm not positive and certainly have no experience with it). Any movie I stream works flawlessly and without synchronization issues. In the case of Netflix, I get playback control on the device I start the cast with, and get options for languages and subtitles that are easy to find.I also found that it works well with DLNA content, and streams media from my mythtv DVR as long as I put a transcode job on all of my recordings to something the Chromcast can understand. There are multiple apps available to chromecast DLNA content, I'll leave it up to you to find your favorite.On the downside, it would be nice to have a device that can display whatever is on the screen of my device, but this isn't it. This merely connects to media servers and streams, with control from local devices.
